main event: A witness reported observing a large silver object above Mt. Rainier on January 9, 1959, which appeared to hover before taking off at high speed.
interesting points: The object was as bright as a full moon and made no sound during the sighting., The object started as the size of a silver dollar and appeared to be 15 to 18 feet in diameter when it left., The witness confirmed the sighting with their spouse., The authorities in Seattle had no reports of unidentified objects in the area that night., The object seemed to reflect a pulsating light before taking off.
witness description: The primary witness was a local resident who observed the object along with their spouse.
